article.headline: E. Kentucky 46, Samford 38
article.story: RICHMOND, Ky. (AP) -- Adam Leonard hit a 3-pointer with four minutes left and Eastern Kentucky hit five free throws in the final 37 seconds as the Colonels beat Samford 46-38 Tuesday night. Leonard finished with 12 points for Eastern (16-9, 11-6 Ohio Valley Conference), and Michael Brock also scored 12. Mike Rose added 10. Travis Peterson led Samford (14-12, 11-6) with 23 points, including the team's first 11 points of the game. Eastern won its sixth straight game, despite being held to its second lowest scoring total of the year and shooting just 38.6 percent from the field. Eastern lost to Ohio State 74-45 on Nov. 17. Samford trailed 41-38 with 43 seconds left on a 3-pointer by Curtis West, but Brock hit three free throws and Rose had two to seal the win.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
